$description: Structural focus ring primitives for keyboard navigation accessibility (width and offset only). Focus ring color is a semantic concern handled by color.focus.ring in each theme's semantic-color.tokens.json. Focus indicators are CRITICAL for accessibility - they show keyboard users which element is active. WCAG 2.4.7 requires visible focus indicators. RULE: Never remove focus styles without providing an alternative. Use :focus-visible for keyboard-only focus.

focus.$description: Focus ring structural configuration (dimensions only). Color is defined in the semantic layer per theme.

ring.$description: Focus ring dimensions. Uses outline (not border) to avoid layout shifts. Width and offset control ring size and spacing; color is defined semantically per theme via color.focus.ring.

width.$description: Focus ring width (3px). Thick enough to be clearly visible per WCAG 2.4.11 (Focus Appearance). Use for: outline-width property. 3px provides clear visibility without being obtrusive. Consistent across all focusable elements.

offset.$description: Focus ring offset from element (2px). Creates gap between element and focus ring for clarity. Use for: outline-offset property. Prevents focus ring from overlapping element borders. Ensures ring is visible on both light and dark backgrounds.
